sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new StepNavigation. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSettings settings} : object
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getShowThumbnails showThumbnails} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowToolbar showToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowStepInfo showStepInfo} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getProcedureItemTemplate procedureItemTemplate} : sap.ui.core.Item
    • {@link #getStepInfoPopup stepInfoPopup} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.m.Toolbar
    • {@link #getThumbnailsContainer thumbnailsContainer} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
  • Associations
    • {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:resize resize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:stepChanged stepChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getContentConnector.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getContentConnector contentConnector}, or null.

playStep.!type: fn(stepId: String, fromTheBeginning: Boolean, continueToTheNext: Boolean)

parameters.continueToTheNext: type: boolean, description: Default: false If true, tells the Viewer to play the next step in sequence.
parameters.fromTheBeginning: type: boolean, description: Default: true If true, tells the Viewer to play the step from the first frame.
parameters.stepId: type: string, description: The ID of the procedure step to play.

detachStepChanged.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:stepChanged stepChanged} event of this sap.ui.vk.StepNavigation. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

getStepInfoPopup.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getStepInfoPopup stepInfoPopup}.

sap.ui.core.Popup used to render step information in a popup.

destroyStepInfoPopup.!description: Destroys the stepInfoPopup in the aggregation {@link #getStepInfoPopup stepInfoPopup}.

parameters.oProcedureItemTemplate: type: sap.ui.core.Item, description: The procedureItemTemplate to set

setScene.!description: Attaches a Scene object to the Step Navigation control so that it can access the Scene’s procedures and steps.

parameters.scene: type: object, description: The Scene object to attach to the Step Navigation control.

getShowStepInfo.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowStepInfo showStepInfo}. Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display a popup containing information around the step that is playing. If set to true, then the popup is rendered. If set to false, the popup is hidden. Default value is false.

clear.!description: Clears the content of the Step Navigation control.

refresh.!description: Rebuilds the content of the Step Navigation control from the current Scene.

parameters.oScene: type: object, description: The scene object to be used.

setShowThumbnails.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowThumbnails showThumbnails}. Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display thumbnails. If set to true, then thumbnails are rendered. If set to false, then thumbnails are hidden. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowThumbnails: type: boolean, description: New value for property showThumbnails

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. Width of the Step Navigation control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 100%.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

enumerateOutlinedNodes.!description: Enumerates IDs of the outlined nodes.

parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the outlined nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type string.

setTintColor.!description: Sets the tint color of the nodes.
setTintColor.!type: fn(nodeRefs: [Object | Object], tintColor: [sap.ui.vk.CSSColor | Number | sap.ui.vk.CSSColor[] | Number], recursive?: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager

parameters.tintColor: type: sap.ui.vk.CSSColor|int|sap.ui.vk.CSSColor[]|int[]|null, description: The new tint color of the nodes. The value can be defined as a string in the CSS color format or as an integer in the ABGR format or it could be array of these values. If null is passed then the tint color is reset and the node's own tint color should be used.
parameters.nodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references.
parameters.recursive: type: boolean, description: This flag indicates if the change needs to propagate recursively to child nodes.

setSelectionState.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.56.3 undefined
Sets the selection state of the nodes.
setSelectionState.!type: fn(nodeRefs: [Object | Object], selected: Boolean, recursive: Boolean, blockNotification: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager

parameters.blockNotification: type: boolean, description: The flag to suppres selectionChanged event.
parameters.nodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references.
parameters.selected: type: boolean, description: The new selection state of the nodes.
parameters.recursive: type: boolean, description: The flags indicates if the change needs to propagate recursively to child nodes.

getOpacity.!description:
Gets the opacity of the node. If a single node is passed to the method then a single value is returned.
If an array of nodes is passed to the method then an array of values is returned.

parameters.nodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references.

setShowSelectionBoundingBox.!description: Sets if showing the bounding box when nodes are selected

parameters.val: type: boolean, description: true if bounding boxes of selected nodes are shown, false otherwise.

parameters.inABGRFormat: type: boolean, description: This flag indicates to return the highlighting color in the ABGR format, if it equals false then the color is returned in the CSS color format.

setOutliningStates.!description: Sets or resets the outlining state of the nodes.
setOutliningStates.!type: fn(outlinedNodeRefs: [Object | Object], unoutlinedNodeRefs: [Object | Object], recursive: Boolean, blockNotification: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager

parameters.outlinedNodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references of outlined nodes.
parameters.unoutlinedNodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references of un-outlined nodes.
parameters.blockNotification: type: boolean, description: The flag to suppres outlineChanged event.
parameters.recursive: type: boolean, description: The flags indicates if the change needs to propagate recursively to child nodes.

enumerateSelection.!description: Enumerates IDs of the selected nodes.

parameters.callback: type: function, description: A function to call when the selected nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type string.

getVisibilityState.!description:
Gets the visibility state of nodes. If a single node is passed to the method then a single visibility state is returned.
If an array of nodes is passed to the method then an array of visibility states is returned.

sap.ui.vk.NodeProxy.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NodeProxy. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getNodeRef nodeRef} : any
    • {@link #getVeIds veIds} : object[]
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getLocalMatrix localMatrix} : sap.ui.vk.TransformationMatrix
    • {@link #getWorldMatrix worldMatrix} : sap.ui.vk.TransformationMatrix
    • {@link #getMaterial material} : sap.ui.vk.Material
    • {@link #getOpacity opacity} : float
    • {@link #getTintColorABGR tintColorABGR} : int
    • {@link #getTintColor tintColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor
    • {@link #getNodeMetadata nodeMetadata} : object
    • {@link #getHasChildren hasChildren} : boolean
    • {@link #getClosed closed} : boolean
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

Gets current value of property {@link #getHasChildren hasChildren}.

The indicator showing if the node has child nodes. This property is read-only.

Gets current value of property {@link #getVeIds veIds}.

The node VE IDs. This property is read-only.

sap.ui.vk.tools.RotateTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RotateTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCoordinateSystem coordinateSystem} : sap.ui.vk.tools.CoordinateSystem (default: World)
    • {@link #getAxis axis} : sap.ui.vk.tools.RotatableAxis (default: All)
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet} : sap.ui.vk.tools.ToolNodeSet (default: Highlight)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:rotating rotating} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotated rotated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:axisChanged axisChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:coordinateSystemChanged coordinateSystemChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

fireRotated.!description: Fires event {@link #event:rotated rotated} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setEnableStepping.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping}. If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableStepping: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableStepping

getEnableStepping.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping}. If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change Default value is false.

getNodeSet.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet}. Determine what set of nodes will be transformed with this tool Default value is Highlight.

sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NativeViewport. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

    • {@link #event:move move} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for an AnchorPointTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAllowOperation allowOperation} : sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointToolOperation (default: All)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPosition position} : any
    • {@link #getQuaternion quaternion} : any
  • Events
    • {@link #event:moving moving} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:moved moved} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotating rotating} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:rotated rotated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

attachMoved.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:moved moved} event of this sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointTool. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointTool itself. This event will be fired when movement finished.
attachMoved.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.vk.tools.AnchorPointTool

sap.ui.vk.tools.ScaleTool.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ScaleTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCoordinateSystem coordinateSystem} : sap.ui.vk.tools.CoordinateSystem (default: World)
    • {@link #getNonUniformScaleEnabled nonUniformScaleEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet} : sap.ui.vk.tools.ToolNodeSet (default: Highlight)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:scaling scaling} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:scaled scaled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:coordinateSystemChanged coordinateSystemChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

If this is the only top level content resource, the {@link sap.ui.vk.NodeProxy NodeProxy} object is not set since the grouping node is not created, which means that there may be multiple top level nodes.

getEnableLogger.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableLogger enableLogger}.

Optional boolean parameter to enable detailed logging. Can be used to track performance issues during data streaming from SAP 3D Visualisation Service.

getLocalMatrix.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getLocalMatrix localMatrix}.

The local transformation matrix of the node created for this content resource.

getMetadataFilter.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getMetadataFilter metadataFilter}.

Optional metadata filter that can trim the tree before sending to the client only keeping nodes that passed the filter and their parents. Default: null. Format: Comma-separated list of meta.category1.tag1.value1, meta.category2.tag2.value2. "meta." is the prefix and all metadata filters must start with it. Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they dont pass the filter.

setSourceType.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getSourceType sourceType}. The source type of the content resource. Valid types:
  • vds
  • svg
  • png
  • jpg
  • jpeg
  • gif
  • bmp
  • tif
  • tiff
  • stream
The source type may be omitted if this is a grouping content node. NOTE: The tif and tiff image formats are not supported on all browers. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sSourceType: type: string, description: New value for property sourceType

sap.ui.vk.ContentResource.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ContentResource. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSource source} : any
    • {@link #getSourceType sourceType} : string
    • {@link #getSourceId sourceId} : string
    • {@link #getLocalMatrix localMatrix} : sap.ui.vk.TransformationMatrix
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getPassword password} : string
    • {@link #getUseSecureConnection useSecureConnection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVeid veid} : string
    • {@link #getIncludeHidden includeHidden} : boolean
    • {@link #getIncludeAnimation includeAnimation} : boolean
    • {@link #getPushPMI pushPMI} : boolean
    • {@link #getMetadataFilter metadataFilter} : string
    • {@link #getActivateView activateView} : string
    • {@link #getEnableLogger enableLogger} : boolean
    • {@link #getPushViewGroups pushViewGroups} : boolean
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContentResources contentResources} : sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

getActivateView.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getActivateView activateView}.

Optional parameter with view id which shall be activated when scene is loaded.

getContentResources.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContentResources contentResources}.

Child content resources.

removeContentResource.!description: Removes a contentResource from the aggregation {@link #getContentResources contentResources}.

parameters.vContentResource: type: int|string|sap.ui.vk.ContentResource, description: The contentResource to remove or its index or id

setUseSecureConnection.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseSecureConnection useSecureConnection}. If set to false, unsecure connections will be used. Default: true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bUseSecureConnection: type: boolean, description: New value for property useSecureConnection

addContentResource.!description: Adds some contentResource to the aggregation {@link #getContentResources contentResources}.

parameters.oContentResource: type: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource, description: The contentResource to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

collectCategories.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.50.0 undefined
Collects content resource categories. The result is tested if the content resource hierarchy has the same category - 2D or 3D.

parameters.resources: type: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[], description: The array of content resources.

setEnableLogger.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableLogger enableLogger}. Optional boolean parameter to enable detailed logging. Can be used to track performance issues during data streaming from SAP 3D Visualisation Service. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.bEnableLogger: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableLogger

setVeid.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getVeid veid}. Id of scene to retrieve tree for. Mandatory for the stream source type. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sVeid: type: string, description: New value for property veid

removeAllContentResources.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getContentResources contentResources}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

getSourceProperties.!description:
Gets content resource source properties. The content resource source properties depend on the content resource source type. They are different for VDS and PNG for example. The list of possible source properties:
  • version - object
    • major - number
    • minor - number
  • compressed - boolean
  • encrypted - boolean
The source properties are optional and the list might be extended in future versions.

setLocalMatrix.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getLocalMatrix localMatrix}. The local transformation matrix of the node created for this content resource. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sLocalMatrix: type: sap.ui.vk.TransformationMatrix, description: New value for property localMatrix

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vk.ContentResource.

setIncludeAnimation.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIncludeAnimation includeAnimation}. Send structural data for animation objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.bIncludeAnimation: type: boolean, description: New value for property includeAnimation

getSourceType.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSourceType sourceType}. The source type of the content resource. Valid types:
  • vds
  • svg
  • png
  • jpg
  • jpeg
  • gif
  • bmp
  • tif
  • tiff
  • stream
The source type may be omitted if this is a grouping content node. NOTE: The tif and tiff image formats are not supported on all browers.

setIncludeHidden.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIncludeHidden includeHidden}. Send structural data for hidden objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.bIncludeHidden: type: boolean, description: New value for property includeHidden

getUseSecureConnection.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseSecureConnection useSecureConnection}. If set to false, unsecure connections will be used. Default: true. Default value is true.

getIncludeAnimation.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIncludeAnimation includeAnimation}.

Send structural data for animation objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

getPushPMI.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPushPMI pushPMI}.

If set to true, elements for PMI rendering content will be returned. Default: false.

setMetadataFilter.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMetadataFilter metadataFilter}. Optional metadata filter that can trim the tree before sending to the client only keeping nodes that passed the filter and their parents. Default: null. Format: Comma-separated list of meta.category1.tag1.value1, meta.category2.tag2.value2. "meta." is the prefix and all metadata filters must start with it. Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they dont pass the filter. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sMetadataFilter: type: string, description: New value for property metadataFilter

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.vk.ContentResource with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

setSourceId.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSourceId sourceId}. The unique ID of the content resource. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sSourceId: type: string, description: New value for property sourceId

getPassword.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPassword password}.

The password to use when opening the resource.

destroyContentResources.!description: Destroys all the contentResources in the aggregation {@link #getContentResources contentResources}.

setPushPMI.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPushPMI pushPMI}. If set to true, elements for PMI rendering content will be returned. Default: false. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.bPushPMI: type: boolean, description: New value for property pushPMI

getSource.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSource source}.

The source URL or the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File File} object of the content resource/file to load from. The source may be omitted if a grouping node is needed.

getIncludeHidden.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIncludeHidden includeHidden}.

Send structural data for hidden objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

setActivateView.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getActivateView activateView}. Optional parameter with view id which shall be activated when scene is loaded. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sActivateView: type: string, description: New value for property activateView

getPushViewGroups.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPushViewGroups pushViewGroups}.

If set to true, infomation of view groups will be returned. Default: true.

getSourceId.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSourceId sourceId}.

The unique ID of the content resource.

indexOfContentResource.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.vk.ContentResource in the aggregation {@link #getContentResources contentResources}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oContentResource: type: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource, description: The contentResource whose index is looked for

insertContentResource.!description: Inserts a contentResource into the aggregation {@link #getContentResources contentResources}.

parameters.oContentResource: type: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource, description: The contentResource to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the contentResource should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the contentResource is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the contentResource is inserted at the last position

setPushViewGroups.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPushViewGroups pushViewGroups}. If set to true, infomation of view groups will be returned. Default: true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.bPushViewGroups: type: boolean, description: New value for property pushViewGroups

sap.ui.vk.Viewport.!description: Provides a rendering canvas for the 3D elements of a loaded scene.

showHotspots.!type: fn(nodeRefs: [Object | Object], show: Boolean, color: Number | sap.ui.vk.CSSColor) -> sap.ui.vk.Viewport

parameters.color: type: int|sap.ui.vk.CSSColor, description: The color to use for highlighting the nodes passed as argument.
parameters.show: type: boolean, description: Whether to highlight the nodes or remove the highlight.
parameters.nodeRefs: type: any|any[], description: The node reference or the array of node references that we want to tint.

setViewInfo.!description:
Sets the current scene to use the camera view information acquired from the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#getViewInfo getViewInfo} method.
Internally, the setViewInfo method activates certain steps at certain animation times, and then changes the camera position, rotation and field of view (FOV) / zoom factor.

parameters.flyToDuration: type: float, description: Fly-to animation duration in seconds.
parameters.viewInfo: type: object, description: A JSON-like object containing view information acquired using the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#getViewInfo getViewInfo} method.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vk.Viewport.

tap.!description: Executes a click or tap gesture.
tap.!type: fn(x: Number, y: Number, isDoubleClick: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.Viewport

parameters.isDoubleClick: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether the tap gesture should be interpreted as a double-click. A value of true indicates a double-click gesture, and false indicates a single click gesture.
parameters.x: type: int, description: The tap gesture's x-coordinate.
parameters.y: type: int, description: The tap gesture's y-coordinate.

getCurrentView.!description: Get current view - remembered when activateView function is called

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.vk.Viewport with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.vk.ViewportBase.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

zoomTo.!description: Zooms the scene to a bounding box created from a particular set of nodes.
zoomTo.!type: fn(what: [sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo | sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo], nodeRef: Object, crossFadeSeconds: Number, margin: Number) -> sap.ui.vk.Viewport

parameters.margin: type: float, description: Margin. Set to 0 to zoom to the entire screen.
parameters.what: type: sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo|sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo[], description: What set of nodes to zoom to.
parameters.crossFadeSeconds: type: float, description: Time to perform the "fly to" animation. Set to 0 to do this immediately.
parameters.nodeRef: type: any, description: Is only used if what == sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo.Node.

activateView.!type: fn(view: sap.ui.vk.View, playViewGroup: Boolean, notAnimateCameraChange: Boolean) -> sap.ui.vk.Viewport

parameters.notAnimateCameraChange: type: boolean, description: true if not animating the change of camera
parameters.playViewGroup: type: boolean, description: true if view activation is part of playing view group

sap.ui.vk.Viewport.!helpDescription: Provides a rendering canvas for the 3D elements of a loaded scene.

getViewInfo.!description: Retrieves information about the current camera view in the scene, and saves the information in a JSON-like object. The information can then be used at a later time to restore the scene to the same camera view using the {@link sap.ui.vk.Viewport#setViewInfo setViewInfo} method.

parameters.query: type: object, description: Query object which indicates what information to be retrieved.

getImage.!description: Returns viewport content as an image of desired size.
getImage.!type: fn(width: Number, height: Number, topColor: String, bottomColor: String, includeSelection: Boolean) -> String

parameters.topColor: type: string, description: The sap.ui.core.CSSColor to be used for top background color
parameters.includeSelection: type: boolean, description: Include selected nodes
parameters.width: type: int, description: Requested image width in pixels (allowed values 8 to 2048)
parameters.height: type: int, description: Requested image height in pixels (allowed values 8 to 2048)
parameters.bottomColor: type: string, description: The sap.ui.core.CSSColor to be used for bottom background color

sap.ui.vk.Material.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Material. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getId id} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getAmbientColour ambientColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getDiffuseColour diffuseColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getSpecularColour specularColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getEmissiveColour emissiveColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getOpacity opacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getGlossiness glossiness} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getLineColour lineColour} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1))
    • {@link #getLineWidth lineWidth} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getTextureDiffuse textureDiffuse} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureBump textureBump} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureOpacity textureOpacity} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureReflection textureReflection} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureEmissive textureEmissive} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
    • {@link #getTextureAmbientOcclusion textureAmbientOcclusion} : sap.ui.vk.Texture
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

getLineWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getLineWidth lineWidth}. Line width (optional) Default value is 0.

parameters.sId: type: string, description: New value for property id

uvHorizontalTilingEnabled.!description: Is the uv horizontal tiling enabled

hasChildren.!description: The indicator showing if the node has child nodes. This property is read-only.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

specularColour.!description: Specular colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

backgroundColorBottom.!description: Viewport background bottom color in the CSS Color format

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

diffuseColour.!description: Diffuse colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

upDirection.!description: Camera up vector in global space (normalized x, y, z vector values)

localMatrix.!description: The local transformation matrix of the node.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

veIds.!description: The node VE IDs. This property is read-only.

lineColour.!description: Line colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

ambientColour.!description: Ambient colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

emissiveColour.!description: Emissive colour (optional) - red, green, blue, and alhpa

targetDirection.!description: Camera direction vector in global space (normalized x, y, z vector values)

nodeRef.!description: The node reference. This property is read-only.

tintColorABGR.!description:
The tint color.
The tint color is a 32-bit integer in the ABGR notation, where A is amount of blending between material color and tint color.

name.!description: The name of the node. This property is read-only.

position.!description: Camera position in global space (x, y, z coordinates)

fov.!description: Camera frustum field of view in degree

uvVerticalTilingEnabled.!description: Is the uv vertical tiling enabled

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

showDebugInfo.!description: Shows or hides the debug info.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

backgroundColorTop.!description: Viewport background top color in the CSS Color format

nodeMetadata.!description: The node metadata. This property is read-only.

worldMatrix.!description: The world transformation matrix of the node.

closed.!description: The indicator showing if the node is closed. This property is read-only.

sap.ui.vk.Overlay.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Overlay. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties

    • {@link #getAreas areas} : sap.ui.vk.OverlayArea[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getTarget target} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:click click} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contextMenu contextMenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.MapContainer.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MapContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowNavbar showNavbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHome showHome} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowMapLayer showMapLayer} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowRectangularZoom showRectangularZoom} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowZoom showZoom} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getListPanelStack listPanelStack} : sap.ui.vk.ListPanelStack
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.ContainerBase#constructor sap.ui.vk.ContainerBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.vk.MapContainer.!helpDescription: Abstract Constructor for a new Container.
